message_1: How many ways are there to divide a group of 10 people into 3 teams of sizes 3, 3 and 4, respectively?
message_2:
To divide a group of 10 people into 3 teams of sizes 3, 3, and 4, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

First, we need to choose 4 people out of 10 for the largest team. This can be done in C(10, 4) ways.

C(10, 4) = 10! / (4!(10-4)!) = 10! / (4!6!) = 210

Now, we have 6 people left. We need to choose 3 people for one of the remaining teams. This can be done in C(6, 3) ways.

C(6, 3) = 6! / (3!(6-3)!) = 6! / (3!3!) = 20

The last 3 people will automatically form the third team, so we don't need to calculate anything for that.

Now, we just need to multiply the number of ways to form each team:

Total ways = C(10, 4) * C(6, 3) = 210 * 20 = 4200

So, there are 4200 ways to divide a group of 10 people into 3 teams of sizes 3, 3, and 4, respectively.
